author: confucius
quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: confucius
quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.

author: confucius
quote: He who learns but does not think, is lost! He who thinks but does not learn is in great danger.

author: confucius
quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.

author: confucius
quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.

author: confucius
quote: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.

author: confucius
quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.

author: confucius
quote: It is easy to hate and it is difficult to love. This is how the whole scheme of things works. All good things are difficult to achieve; and bad things are very easy to get.

author: confucius
quote: To know what you know and what you do not know, that is true knowledge.

author: confucius
quote: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.

author: confucius
quote: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.

author: confucius
quote: Better a diamond with a flaw than a pebble without.

author: confucius
quote: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.

author: confucius
quote: What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.

author: confucius
quote: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.

author: confucius
quote: The object of the superior man is truth.

author: confucius
quote: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.

author: confucius
quote: Do not impose on others what you yourself do not desire.

author: confucius
quote: A superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.

author: confucius
quote: When anger rises, think of the consequences.

author: confucius
quote: Never give a sword to a man who can't dance.

author: confucius
quote: The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home.

author: confucius
quote: You cannot open a book without learning something.

author: confucius
quote: The superior man understands what is right; the inferior man understands what will sell.

author: confucius
quote: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.

author: confucius
quote: If I am walking with two other men, each of them will serve as my teacher. I will pick out the good points of the one and imitate them, and the bad points of the other and correct them in myself.

author: confucius
quote: In a country well governed, poverty is something to be ashamed of. In a country badly governed, wealth is something to be ashamed of.

author: confucius
quote: If you think in terms of a year, plant a seed; if in terms of ten years, plant trees; if in terms of 100 years, teach the people.

author: confucius
quote: Never contract friendship with a man that is not better than thyself.

author: confucius
quote: I hear, I know. I see, I remember. I do, I understand.

author: confucius
quote: To see the right and not to do it is cowardice.

author: confucius
quote: To see what is right and not to do it is want of courage, or of principle.

author: confucius
quote: Learning without thought is labor lost; thought without learning is perilous.

author: confucius
quote: Humility is the solid foundation of all virtues.

author: confucius
quote: Success depends upon previous preparation, and without such preparation there is sure to be failure.

author: confucius
quote: When you know a thing, to hold that you know it, and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it - this is knowledge.

author: confucius
quote: Study the past, if you would divine the future.

author: confucius
quote: Silence is a true friend who never betrays.

author: confucius
quote: The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.

author: confucius
quote: There are three methods to gaining wisdom. The first is reflection, which is the highest. The second is limitation, which is the easiest. The third is experience, which is the bitterest.

author: confucius
quote: A gentleman would be ashamed should his deeds not match his words.

author: confucius
quote: They must often change, who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.

author: confucius
quote: Without feelings of respect, what is there to distinguish men from beasts?

author: confucius
quote: It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.

author: confucius
quote: Virtue is not left to stand alone. He who practices it will have neighbors.

author: confucius
quote: Old age, believe me, is a good and pleasant thing. It is true you are gently shouldered off the stage, but then you are given such a comfortable front stall as spectator.

author: confucius
quote: The expectations of life depend upon diligence; the mechanic that would perfect his work must first sharpen his tools.

author: confucius
quote: To go beyond is as wrong as to fall short.

author: confucius
quote: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.

author: confucius
quote: An oppressive government is more to be feared than a tiger.

author: confucius
quote: If we don't know life, how can we know death?

author: confucius
quote: A youth, when at home, should be filial and, abroad, respectful to his elders. He should be earnest and truthful. He should overflow in love to all and cultivate the friendship of the good. When he has time and opportunity, after the performance of these things, he should employ them in polite studies.

author: confucius
quote: To practice five things under all circumstances constitutes perfect virtue; these five are gravity, generosity of soul, sincerity, earnestness, and kindness.

author: confucius
quote: The superior man is distressed by the limitations of his ability; he is not distressed by the fact that men do not recognize the ability that he has.

author: confucius
quote: Heaven means to be one with God.

author: confucius
quote: The cautious seldom err.

author: confucius
quote: The superior man thinks always of virtue; the common man thinks of comfort.

author: confucius
quote: Death and life have their determined appointments; riches and honors depend upon heaven.

author: confucius
quote: I will not be concerned at other men's not knowing me; I will be concerned at my own want of ability.

author: suntzu
quote: If you know the enemy and know yourself you need not fear the results of a hundred battles.

author: suntzu
quote: To fight and conquer in all our battles is not supreme excellence; supreme excellence consists in breaking the enemy's resistance without fighting.

author: suntzu
quote: He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.

author: suntzu
quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.

author: suntzu
quote: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.

author: suntzu
quote: If fighting is sure to result in victory, than you must fight, even though the ruler forbid it; if fighting will not result in victory, then you must not fight even at the ruler's bidding.

author: suntzu
quote: All men can see these tactics whereby I conquer, but what none can see is the strategy out of which victory is evolved.

author: suntzu
quote: Be extremely subtle, even to the point of formlessness. Be extremely mysterious, even to the point of soundlessness. Thereby you can be the director of the opponent's fate.

author: suntzu
quote: Know thy self, know thy enemy. A thousand battles, a thousand victories.

author: suntzu
quote: The art of war teaches us to rely not on the likelihood of the enemy's not coming, but on our own readiness to receive him; not on the chance of his not attacking, but rather on the fact that we have made our position unassailable.

author: suntzu
quote: Regard your soldiers as your children, and they will follow you into the deepest valleys; look on them as your own beloved sons, and they will stand by you even unto death.

author: suntzu
quote: There is no instance of a nation benefitting from prolonged warfare.

author: suntzu
quote: For to win one hundred victories in one hundred battles is not the acme of skill. To subdue the enemy without fighting is the acme of skill.

author: suntzu
quote: Invincibility lies in the defence; the possibility of victory in the attack.

author: suntzu
quote: Pretend inferiority and encourage his arrogance.

author: suntzu
quote: Hence the saying: If you know the enemy and you know yourself, your victory will not stand in doubt; if you know Heaven and you know Earth, you may make your victory complete.

author: suntzu
quote: Thus, what is of supreme importance in war is to attack the enemy's strategy.

author: suntzu
quote: The general who wins the battle makes many calculations in his temple before the battle is fought. The general who loses makes but few calculations beforehand.

author: suntzu
quote: Thus it is that in war the victorious strategist only seeks battle after the victory has been won, whereas he who is destined to defeat first fights and afterwards looks for victory.

author: suntzu
quote: Know your enemy and know yourself and you can fight a hundred battles without disaster.

author: suntzu
quote: The quality of decision is like the well-timed swoop of a falcon which enables it to strike and destroy its victim.

author: suntzu
quote: The general who advances without coveting fame and retreats without fearing disgrace, whose only thought is to protect his country and do good service for his sovereign, is the jewel of the kingdom.

author: suntzu
quote: The art of war is of vital importance to the state. It is a matter of life and death, a road either to safety or to ruin. Hence it is a subject of inquiry which can on no account be neglected.

author: suntzu
quote: He who knows when he can fight and when he cannot, will be victorious.

author: suntzu
quote: The opportunity to secure ourselves against defeat lies in our own hands, but the opportunity of defeating the enemy is provided by the enemy himself.

author: suntzu
quote: Confront them with annihilation, and they will then survive; plunge them into a deadly situation, and they will then live. When people fall into danger, they are then able to strive for victory.

author: suntzu
quote: If ignorant both of your enemy and yourself, you are certain to be in peril.

author: suntzu
quote: He who is prudent and lies in wait for an enemy who is not, will be victorious.

author: suntzu
quote: If your opponent is of choleric temper, irritate him.

author: suntzu
quote: Quickness is the essence of the war.

author: suntzu
quote: If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.

author: suntzu
quote: Secret operations are essential in war; upon them the army relies to make its every move.

author: suntzu
quote: Supreme excellence consists in breaking the enemy's resistance without fighting.

author: suntzu
quote: Balk the enemy's power; force him to reveal himself.

author: suntzu
quote: A good commander is benevolent and unconcerned with fame.

author: suntzu
quote: To see victory only when it is within the ken of the common herd is not the acme of excellence.

author: suntzu
quote: Now the reason the enlightened prince and the wise general conquer the enemy whenever they move and their achievements surpass those of ordinary men is foreknowledge.

author: suntzu
quote: When envoys are sent with compliments in their mouths, it is a sign that the enemy wishes for a truce.

author: suntzu
quote: The good fighters of old first put themselves beyond the possibility of defeat, and then waited for an opportunity of defeating the enemy.

author: suntzu
quote: There has never been a protracted war from which a country has benefited.

author: suntzu
quote: He will win whose army is animated by the same spirit throughout all its ranks.

author: suntzu
quote: It is essential to seek out enemy agents who have come to conduct espionage against you and to bribe them to serve you. Give them instructions and care for them. Thus doubled agents are recruited and used.

author: suntzu
quote: The enlightened ruler is heedful, and the good general full of caution.

author: suntzu
quote: Prohibit the taking of omens, and do away with superstitious doubts. Then, until death itself comes, no calamity need be feared.

author: suntzu
quote: Victory usually goes to the army who has better trained officers and men.

author: suntzu
quote: If our soldiers are not overburdened with money, it is not because they have a distaste for riches; if their lives are not unduly long, it is not because they are disinclined to longevity.

author: suntzu
quote: In the practical art of war, the best thing of all is to take the enemy's country whole and intact; to shatter and destroy it is not so good.

author: suntzu
quote: Hence that general is skilful in attack whose opponent does not know what to defend; and he is skilful in defense whose opponent does not know what to attack.

author: suntzu
quote: He will win who knows how to handle both superior and inferior forces.

author: suntzu
quote: For them to perceive the advantage of defeating the enemy, they must also have their rewards.

author: suntzu
quote: It is only the enlightened ruler and the wise general who will use the highest intelligence of the army for the purposes of spying, and thereby they achieve great results.

author: suntzu
quote: Of all those in the army close to the commander none is more intimate than the secret agent; of all rewards none more liberal than those given to secret agents; of all matters none is more confidential than those relating to secret operations.

author: suntzu
quote: If we know that our own men are in a condition to attack, but are unaware that the enemy is not open to attack, we have gone only halfway towards victory.

author: shakespeare
quote: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.

author: shakespeare
quote: Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.

author: shakespeare
quote: All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players: they have their exits and their entrances; and one man in his time plays many parts, his acts being seven ages.

author: shakespeare
quote: A fool thinks himself to be wise, but a wise man knows himself to be a fool.

author: shakespeare
quote: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.

author: shakespeare
quote: There is nothing either good or bad but thinking makes it so.

author: shakespeare
quote: There is a tide in the affairs of men, Which taken at the flood, leads on to fortune. Omitted, all the voyage of their life is bound in shallows and in miseries. On such a full sea are we now afloat. And we must take the current when it serves, or lose our ventures.

author: shakespeare
quote: Hell is empty and all the devils are here.

author: shakespeare
quote: The evil that men do lives after them; the good is oft interred with their bones.

author: shakespeare
quote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.

author: shakespeare
quote: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another.

author: shakespeare
quote: What's in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet.

author: shakespeare
quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths; the valiant never taste of death but once.

author: shakespeare
quote: As flies to wanton boys, are we to the gods; they kill us for their sport.

author: shakespeare
quote: No legacy is so rich as honesty.

author: shakespeare
quote: To thine own self be true, and it must follow, as the night the day, thou canst not then be false to any man.

author: shakespeare
quote: To do a great right do a little wrong.

author: shakespeare
quote: Better three hours too soon than a minute too late.

author: shakespeare
quote: The course of true love never did run smooth.

author: shakespeare
quote: Good night, good night! Parting is such sweet sorrow, that I shall say good night till it be morrow.

author: shakespeare
quote: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind.

author: shakespeare
quote: The undiscovered country from whose bourn no traveler returns.

author: shakespeare
quote: When sorrows come, they come not single spies, but in battalions.

author: shakespeare
quote: The empty vessel makes the loudest sound.

author: shakespeare
quote: Love sought is good, but given unsought, is better.

author: shakespeare
quote: If you prick us do we not bleed? If you tickle us do we not laugh? If you poison us do we not die? And if you wrong us shall we not revenge?

author: shakespeare
quote: This life, which had been the tomb of his virtue and of his honour, is but a walking shadow; a poor player, that struts and frets his hour upon the stage, and then is heard no more: it is a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.

author: shakespeare
quote: It is a wise father that knows his own child.

author: shakespeare
quote: Our doubts are traitors and make us lose the good we oft might win by fearing to attempt.

author: shakespeare
quote: Ignorance is the curse of God; knowledge is the wing wherewith we fly to heaven.

author: shakespeare
quote: How far that little candle throws its beams! So shines a good deed in a naughty world.

author: shakespeare
quote: Sweet are the uses of adversity which, like the toad, ugly and venomous, wears yet a precious jewel in his head.

author: shakespeare
quote: Though she be but little, she is fierce.

author: shakespeare
quote: Listen to many, speak to a few.

author: shakespeare
quote: Some rise by sin, and some by virtue fall.

author: shakespeare
quote: The robbed that smiles, steals something from the thief.

author: shakespeare
quote: One touch of nature makes the whole world kin.

author: shakespeare
quote: There's no art to find the mind's construction in the face.

author: shakespeare
quote: Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind.

author: shakespeare
quote: Better a witty fool than a foolish wit.

author: shakespeare
quote: We are such stuff as dreams are made on; and our little life is rounded with a sleep.

author: shakespeare
quote: I wasted time, and now doth time waste me.

author: shakespeare
quote: Men are April when they woo, December when they wed. Maids are May when they are maids, but the sky changes when they are wives.

author: shakespeare
quote: Give every man thy ear, but few thy voice.

author: shakespeare
quote: Heat not a furnace for your foe so hot that it do singe yourself.

author: shakespeare
quote: What's done can't be undone.

author: shakespeare
quote: Who could refrain that had a heart to love and in that heart courage to make love known?

author: shakespeare
quote: Doubt thou the stars are fire, Doubt that the sun doth move. Doubt truth to be a liar, But never doubt I love.

author: shakespeare
quote: Life is as tedious as twice-told tale, vexing the dull ear of a drowsy man.

author: shakespeare
quote: How sharper than a serpent's tooth it is to have a thankless child!

author: shakespeare
quote: Boldness be my friend.

author: shakespeare
quote: Sweet mercy is nobility's true badge.

author: shakespeare
quote: Speak low, if you speak love.

author: shakespeare
quote: And this, our life, exempt from public haunt, finds tongues in trees, books in the running brooks, sermons in stones, and good in everything.

author: shakespeare
quote: This above all; to thine own self be true.

author: shakespeare
quote: If you can look into the seeds of time, and say which grain will grow and which will not, speak then unto me.

author: shakespeare
quote: The man that hath no music in himself, Nor is not moved with concord of sweet sounds, is fit for treasons, stratagems and spoils.

author: shakespeare
quote: Things done well and with a care, exempt themselves from fear.

author: shakespeare
quote: They do not love that do not show their love.

author: shakespeare
quote: When we are born we cry that we are come to this great stage of fools.
